See [[Talk:Donald Trump#Current consensus]], item 48. --> In the [[2020 U.S. presidential election]], major news organizations have projected that Trump lost his bid for re-election, the first incumbent president to do so since [[George H. W. Bush]] in [[1992 United States presidential election|1992]].

title: Donald Trump
deleted: Trump's political rhetoric has been characterized by his repeated promotion of conspiracy theories. When he first considered running for the Republican presidential nomination in 2011, Trump drew attention for his promotion of the "[[Birther conspiracy|birther]]" theory, according to which  President Obama was born in Kenya and ineligible to be president. Following his defeat in his 2020 re-election bid, Trump has promoted conspiracy theories about the election having been rigged against him. Trump has also repeatedly refused to denounce the [[Q Anon|q-anon]] conspiracy theory, according to which leading Democrats are involved in the sex-trafficking and cannibalism of children.<ref>https://apnews.com/article/e230131513bf3df60c76bb1151bc6b7c</ref>

title: Donald Trump

title: Donald Trump
deleted: [[Operation Warp Speed]] was established to facilitate and accelerate the development, manufacturing, and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines, therapeutics, and diagnostics. After it was first revealed in the press on April 29th, 2020,<ref name="cohen"/> President Trump officially announced the [[public-private partnership]] on May 15, 2020.<ref name=conklin>{{Cite news|last=Conklin|first=Audrey|date=15 May 2020|title=Trump launches 'Operation Warp Speed' for coronavirus vaccine|work=Fox Business|url=https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/trump-vaccine-development-operation-warp-speed|url-status=live|access-date=15 May 2020|quote=[President] Trump described the administration's plan as 'a massive scientific industrial and logistical endeavor unlike anything our country has seen since the Manhattan Project' of World War II, with the intent to rapidly develop and distribute a vaccine with help from the U.S. military and world-renowned doctors and scientists.}}</ref> Operation Warp Speed will coordinate existing [[Health and Human Services]]-wide efforts, including the NIH ACTIV partnership for vaccine and therapeutic development, the NIH RADx initiative for diagnostic development, and work by BARDA.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Trump Administration Announces Framework and Leadership for 'Operation Warp Speed'|url=https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2020/05/15/trump-administration-announces-framework-and-leadership-for-operation-warp-speed.html|last=|first=|date=15 May 2020|website=U.S. Department of Health and Human Services|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=15 May 2020|quote=Among its other objectives, Operation Warp Speed aims to have substantial quantities of a safe and effective vaccine available for Americans by January 2021.}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump
added: Trump designated Giuiiani to lead a legal team to challenge the election results, including [[Sidney Powell]], [[Joseph diGenova]], [[Victoria Toensing]] and Trump campaign attorney Jenna Ellis.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/14/politics/rudy-giuliani-trump-lawsuits-2020-election/index.html|title=Trump puts Giuliani in charge of post-election legal fight after series of losses|first=Veronica |last=Stracqualursi|publisher=CNN|date=November 16, 2020|access-date=November 20, 2020}}</ref> The team appeared at a November 19 press conference in which they made numerous false and unsubstantiated assertions revolving around an international [[Communism|Communist]] conspiracy, rigged voting machines and polling place fraud to claim that the election had been stolen from Trump.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/19/politics/giuliani-trump-legal-team-press-briefing-fact-check/index.html|title=Fact checking Giuliani and the Trump legal team's wild, fact-free press conference|first1=Tara |last1=Subramaniam|first2=Holmes|last2=Lybrand|publisher=CNN|date=November 19, 2020|access-date=November 20, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-ap-fact-check-joe-biden-donald-trump-technology-5abd64917ef8be9e9e2078180973e8b3|title=AP Fact Check: Trump legal team's batch of false vote claims|date=November 20, 2020|publisher=The Associated Press|first=Ali|last=Swanson|access-date=November 20, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/11/19/fact-checking-craziest-news-conference-trump-presidency/|title=Analysis | Fact-checking the craziest news conference of the Trump presidency|date=November 19, 2020|first=Glenn|last=Kessler|newspaper=The Washington Post|access-date=November 20, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/media/rudy-giuliani-floated-dangerous-and-incendiary-false-claims-of-election-conspiracy--and-fox-news-broadcast-it-live/2020/11/19/0313eab6-2a9f-11eb-8fa2-06e7cbb145c0_story.html|title=Rudy Giuliani floated 'dangerous' and incendiary false claims of election conspiracy — and Fox News broadcast it live|date=November 19, 2020|first1=Paul|last1=Farhi|first2=Elahe|last2=Izadi|newspaper=The Washington Post|access-date=November 20, 2020}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump
added: With his post-election legal challenges to the election of Biden failing,<ref>Smith, David, ''[https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/20/trump-michigan-republicans-election Trump makes futile last stand to overturn results as Georgia certifies Biden win], The Guardian, November 20, 2020</ref> Trump withdrew from public activities and drew criticism that, given the surge in the pandemic, his retreat was being perceived as irresponsible sulking.<ref>Smith, David, ''[https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/21/trump-monumental-sulk-president-retreats-from-public-eye-covid-ravages-us Trump's monumental sulk: president retreats from public eye as Covid ravages US]'', The Guardian, Saturday, November 21, 2020 </ref>

title: Donald Trump
added: The Trump campaign paid almost 3 million dollars for a recount of 800,000 votes in two Wisconsin jurisdictions.  The recount resulted in 87 more votes for Biden.<ref>{{cite news |las1=Helderman |first1=Rosalind S. |last2=Gardner |first2=Amy |url=https://jsonline.com/story/news/2020/11/20/live-updates-wisconsin-election-recount-dane-milwaukee-counties/6353846002/ |title=Wisconsin recount confirms Biden’s win over Trump, cementing the president’s failure to change the election results |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=November 29, 2020 |access-date=November 30, 2020}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump
added: His presidency is generally viewed as [Historical rankings of presidents of the United States|one of the worst]] in American history by historians and political scientists.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/02/19/opinion/how-does-trump-stack-up-against-the-best-and-worst-presidents.html|title=How Does Trump Stack Up Against the Best — and Worst — Presidents?|work=The New York Times|date=February 19, 2018|accessdate=February 19, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Presidents 2018 Rank by Category|url=https://scri.siena.edu/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/Presidents-2018-Rank-by-Category.pdf|accessdate=February 19, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.csdd.northwestern.edu/research/csdd-survey-results_presidential-leadership-poll_may-2019.pdf|title=The First-Ever Expert Survey on Presidential Leadership on Diversity and Inclusion|last=Tillery Jr.|first=Alvin|date=May 31, 2019|website=Center for the Study of Diversity and Democracy|access-date=June 25, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://scri.siena.edu/2019/02/13/sienas-6th-presidential-expert-poll-1982-2018/|title= Siena's 6th Presidential Expert Poll 1982 – 2018|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref>
